body: Because it seems like he learns new spells every season

That's true in the case of Lux, but that's not generally true. Anything in the old lore that didn't directly mention the Institute of War is still considered Canon, as far as I know.

To my knowledge it was a full lore revamp. which means everything.

Pretty much everything save the shurima stuff and the freljord stuff was all thrown out.

And the stuff that relied on the league is still up in the air about how it's gonna work.

Well, that's not how I understood it... For me, it was just: "we want to get rid of the IoW/the LoL inside the lore because it's a too restricted framework to say interesting stories", but that means that anything that didn't directly mention this problematic element is still valid until further notice. The Rune Wars, the Noxian invasion of Ionia, the Barbarian Wars, etc., is still canon.

I may be wrong... We should ask Jaredan ^^

At a glance it seems so, But pretty much everything revolved around the league for a long while. the noxians only invaded ionia because of the league. The rune wars would've ended the world without the league being created as an alternative. I can't find any sources on the barbarian wars but it also probably had some part tied with the league.

The thing is, in the old lore the league of legends was the center stone, it served as a base for everything that happened, and while it did inhibit things, Removing it without a sufficient replacement has caused issues, such as all lore from before the retcon no longer functioning, except for a few things, such as the freljord and shurima stuff.
